course.description_en: Learn to count from 6 to 10 with fun stories and activities. Discover bigger numbers and practice counting with your fingers and toes.
course.description_ar: تعلم العد من ٦ إلى ١٠ مع القصص والأنشطة الممتعة. اكتشف الأرقام الأكبر ومارس العد بأصابع يديك وقدميك.
course.subject: math

content_data.title: Six Cats Play in the Garden
content_data.content: Look! Here are SIX orange cats. Count with me. ONE cat, TWO cats, THREE cats, FOUR cats, FIVE cats, SIX cats! SIX is more than five. SIX cats play together. They run and jump. They chase butterflies. Meow meow meow! SIX cats have SIX tails. SIX cats have many paws. Hold up SIX fingers. Use one hand for five. Use one finger from other hand. That makes SIX! SIX is a big number. SIX cats are very happy playing together.
learning_objectives: Count to 6 with fingers using both hands

vocabulary_words.definition: The number 6, means six things
Soft animals that say meow
Nice place outside with plants
Run after something playfully
Pretty flying insects with colorful wings
Cat feet with soft pads

content_data.parent_guidance: Show child how to count to 6 using one full hand (5) plus one finger from the other hand. Count six objects around the house. Make meowing sounds together. Help child understand that 6 is bigger than 5.
safety_notes: Use large, safe objects for counting
Ensure no small parts that could be choking hazards
Supervise when looking for objects to count
Keep cat pictures or toys safe and clean
discussion_questions: How many cats do you see?
Can you show me six fingers?
What sound do cats make?

extension_activities.title: Six Object Hunt
extension_activities.description: Find six safe objects around the house like six spoons, six blocks, six books.

extension_activities.title: Cat Movement Game
extension_activities.description: Crawl around like six cats, meowing and pretending to chase butterflies.

content_data.title: Seven Pretty Colors in the Sky
content_data.content: Look up at the sky! There is a beautiful rainbow. A rainbow has SEVEN colors. Count them with me. ONE red, TWO orange, THREE yellow, FOUR green, FIVE blue, SIX purple, SEVEN pink! SEVEN colors make a rainbow. SEVEN is more than six. SEVEN is a special number. You have SEVEN days in one week. Sunday, Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday, Friday, Saturday. That is SEVEN days! SEVEN colors are so pretty. They make us happy. Let's count to SEVEN together!
learning_objectives: Learn that a week has seven days

vocabulary_words.definition: The number 7, means seven things
Pretty colors in the sky after rain
Red, blue, yellow, green and more pretty shades
Blue space above us where clouds live
Seven days from Sunday to Saturday
Times when the sun is shining

materials_needed: Colorful objects (red, orange, yellow, green, blue, purple)
content_data.parent_guidance: Point out different colors around the house. Help child count seven crayons or colored objects. Talk about the days of the week in simple terms. Show rainbow pictures if available. Practice counting to 7 slowly.
safety_notes: Use large, safe colored objects
Supervise use of crayons or art supplies
Ensure art materials are non-toxic
Keep small colored objects away from mouth
discussion_questions: How many colors in a rainbow?
What is your favorite color?
Can you count to seven?

extension_activities.title: Color Collection
extension_activities.description: Collect seven different colored safe objects from around the house.

extension_activities.title: Rainbow Drawing
extension_activities.description: Draw or color a simple rainbow with help from parent.

content_data.title: Eight Fish Swim in the Water
content_data.content: Let's count EIGHT colorful fish! They swim in the clear water. Count with me. ONE fish, TWO fish, THREE fish, FOUR fish, FIVE fish, SIX fish, SEVEN fish, EIGHT fish! EIGHT is more than seven. Now let's swim like fish! Move your arms like swimming. Glub glub glub! EIGHT fish swim together. They are friends. Let's count EIGHT movements. Swim one time! Swim two times! Keep going until EIGHT! EIGHT is a big number. Great job counting to EIGHT!

vocabulary_words.definition: The number 8, means eight things
Animals that live and swim in water
Move through water like fish do
Clear liquid that fish live in
Parts of your body that help you move
Others who like to play together

materials_needed: Blue fabric or scarf (optional for water effect)
content_data.parent_guidance: Demonstrate gentle swimming arm movements. Count to 8 with each swimming motion. Help child move arms safely. Count eight objects together. Keep movements slow and controlled for safety.
safety_notes: Ensure safe, clear space for arm movements
No actual water involved - only pretend swimming
Keep movements gentle and controlled
Hold child's hand if balance is needed
Take breaks if child gets tired
discussion_questions: How many fish are swimming?
Can you swim like a fish?
What do fish do in the water?

extension_activities.title: Eight Fish Count
extension_activities.description: Count eight goldfish crackers or fish-shaped toys.

extension_activities.title: Swimming Dance
extension_activities.description: Dance and move arms like swimming to gentle music.

content_data.title: Nine Balls Bounce Up and Down
content_data.content: Look at NINE colorful balls! Count them with me. ONE ball, TWO balls, THREE balls, FOUR balls, FIVE balls, SIX balls, SEVEN balls, EIGHT balls, NINE balls! NINE is more than eight. NINE balls bounce up and down. Bounce bounce bounce! Let's bounce like balls! Bend your knees and bounce gently. Count each bounce. ONE bounce! TWO bounces! Keep going to NINE bounces! NINE is a very big number. You did great counting to NINE!

vocabulary_words.definition: The number 9, means nine things
Round toys that can bounce and roll
Go up and down like a ball
Having many pretty colors
Bendy parts in the middle of your legs
Soft and careful, not hard

materials_needed: Nine small soft balls or bean bags
content_data.parent_guidance: Hold child's hands while bouncing for safety. Count each bounce out loud together. Use very gentle bouncing motions. Count nine soft objects. Ensure safe surface for movement activities.
safety_notes: Use soft, safe surface for bouncing
Hold child's hands for balance
Keep bouncing gentle and low
No hard surfaces for bouncing
Stop if child feels dizzy or tired
Use large, soft balls only
discussion_questions: How many balls can you count?
Can you bounce like a ball?
What colors are the balls?

extension_activities.title: Ball Collection
extension_activities.description: Gather nine safe balls or round objects and count them.

extension_activities.title: Gentle Bounce Game
extension_activities.description: Sit and gently bounce on a soft surface while counting to nine.

content_data.title: Ten Toes on My Two Feet
content_data.content: Look down at your feet! You have TEN toes. Count them with me. ONE toe, TWO toes, THREE toes, FOUR toes, FIVE toes on one foot. SIX toes, SEVEN toes, EIGHT toes, NINE toes, TEN toes on both feet! TEN is the biggest number we learned. TEN is more than nine. You have TEN fingers too! FIVE on each hand. TEN toes help you walk. TEN fingers help you play. TEN is a very special number. Wiggle your TEN toes. Wiggle your TEN fingers. You are amazing with all your TEN and TEN!
learning_objectives: Understand 10 is the biggest number learned

vocabulary_words.definition: The number 10, means ten things
Five small parts on each foot
Two parts at the end of your legs
Five long parts on each hand
Move back and forth quickly
Very special and wonderful

materials_needed: Socks that can be removed safely
content_data.parent_guidance: Help child count toes and fingers slowly. Make it fun by wiggling toes and fingers together. Ensure child is sitting safely when removing socks. Celebrate reaching the big number 10!
safety_notes: Sit in safe, comfortable position
Remove socks carefully to avoid slipping
Keep feet clean and warm
Count gently without pulling toes
Wash hands before and after activity
discussion_questions: How many toes do you have?
How many fingers do you have?
Can you wiggle your toes?

extension_activities.title: Ten Finger Art
extension_activities.description: Make finger prints or hand prints showing all ten fingers.

extension_activities.title: Toe and Finger Song
extension_activities.description: Sing a counting song while wiggling toes and fingers.

content_data.title: Finding Big Numbers Everywhere
content_data.content: Let's hunt for big numbers! We learned SIX, SEVEN, EIGHT, NINE, and TEN. Let's find them around our house. First, find SIX toys. Next, find SEVEN crayons. Then, find EIGHT blocks. Now, find NINE books. Last, count your TEN fingers! These are big numbers. You are so smart! Count each group slowly. SIX toys for playing. SEVEN crayons for drawing. EIGHT blocks for building. NINE books for reading. TEN fingers for everything! You found all the big numbers!

vocabulary_words.definition: Look for and find things
In many places around us
Good at learning and thinking
Things that are together
Not fast, taking time

content_data.parent_guidance: Help child find objects safely. Count each group together slowly. Let child touch and arrange objects while counting. Make it feel like a fun treasure hunt. Celebrate each successful find.
safety_notes: Choose large, safe objects for young children
Supervise when handling multiple small items
Ensure books are appropriate size and weight
Keep objects organized to prevent tripping
Use only non-toxic crayons
discussion_questions: Which number is the biggest?
Which group has the most things?
What comes after 9?

extension_activities.title: Number Line Creation
extension_activities.description: Arrange found objects in rows from 6 to 10 to see the numbers grow.

extension_activities.title: Big Number Story
extension_activities.description: Tell a story using all the objects found (six toys, seven crayons, etc.).

content_data.title: How Well Do You Know Big Numbers?
content_data.content: Let's play a fun counting game with big numbers! I will ask you about numbers 6, 7, 8, 9, and 10. You can use your fingers and toes to help you count!
learning_objectives: Practice counting skills with big numbers

vocabulary_words.definition: Fun question game to show what you learned
Numbers like 6, 7, 8, 9, 10 that are bigger than 5

materials_needed: Child's fingers and toes for counting
Small objects to count if needed
content_data.parent_guidance: Ask questions slowly and encouragingly. Let child use fingers and toes to count. Help with counting if needed. Celebrate every answer. Keep the quiz positive and fun.
safety_notes: No safety concerns
Keep session positive and encouraging
Take breaks if child gets tired
discussion_questions: Show me six fingers. How many is that?
If you have seven cookies, can you count them?
How many fingers and thumbs on both hands? Count them!
Can you count your toes? How many do you have?
What number comes after 9?

extension_activities.title: Big Number Song
extension_activities.description: Sing a counting song: 'Six, seven, eight, nine, ten - big numbers are my friends!'

extension_activities.title: Finger and Toe Show
extension_activities.description: Show different big numbers using fingers and toes.

content_data.title: Celebrating All Our Big Numbers 6-10
content_data.content: Let's have a big number parade! We learned SIX, SEVEN, EIGHT, NINE, and TEN. These are big numbers! Let's march and count together. First, march and say SIX! Hold up six fingers. Next, march and say SEVEN! Count seven steps. Then, march and say EIGHT! Clap eight times. Now, march and say NINE! Spin around nine times slowly. Finally, march and say TEN! Jump ten times gently! You did it! You know big numbers from 6 to 10. You are a big number champion! Let's count all together: SIX, SEVEN, EIGHT, NINE, TEN!

vocabulary_words.definition: Fun marching celebration
Walk with big, proud steps
Someone who is very good at something
Hit hands together to make sound
Turn around in a circle
Push up with feet and land down

materials_needed: Child's hands for counting and clapping
content_data.parent_guidance: Join the celebration enthusiastically! Do each movement together. Count loudly and clearly. Help child with balance during spinning and jumping. Make it feel like a real celebration of learning big numbers.
safety_notes: Ensure clear, safe space for all movements
Hold child's hand during spinning if needed
Keep jumping gentle and low
Take breaks if child gets tired
Use soft surface for jumping activities
Keep music volume safe for ears
discussion_questions: What's your favorite big number?
Which number is the biggest we learned?
Can you count from 6 to 10 all by yourself?

extension_activities.title: Big Number Certificate
extension_activities.description: Draw a special certificate showing child knows numbers 6-10.

extension_activities.title: Teach Big Numbers
extension_activities.description: Child can teach numbers 6-10 to a sibling, toy, or family member.

extension_activities.title: Count Everything
extension_activities.description: Practice counting to 10 with different objects around the house.
